The initial links between the Russian principalities and Chinese authorities got presumably established as early as in the XIII century. However, Russia's more consistent attempts to infiltrate China date back to the early 16th century. Since then a real evolution of the relationship between the two countries started. For the next four centuries the history of these relationships was very contradictory: from the periods of peaceful co-existence to the stages of fierce intransigence between these countries. XX century has become most contradictory and even tragic in this regard, due to frequent antagonisms of political interests developed by the governments of China and Russia. During this course, the tutor is going to answer the question of why the relationships between the two countries have always been exposed to significant risks and challenges. Much in this regard can be explained by not only purely political, but also cultural and spiritual values that were professed in both societies and influenced the behavior of the governments and the people. Different understanding of the "philosophy of victories and defeats" largely determined the development of real politics for a long-term evolution of these relationships, which creates the background for more complex but better understanding of political priorities in China and Russia today. Thus, this course will be obsessed with not only purely statistical material. A special attention is going to be paid to socio-cultural and ethical issues that have determined the specifics of political decision-making at particular periods of the historical existence of the two countries. Such approach will enable to elaborate in consciousness of the students a more thoughtful understanding of the entire historical evolution along with pros and cons being permanent in the political relationship between China and Russia. A special place in the consideration of the stuff is going to be taken by the ‘personal factor’, which significantly influenced this development. Strovskii focuses on the political priorities of the leading politicians of China and the USSR, and later Russia, which left a significant impact on the make-up of the entire evolutionary process. Like the first course, this one also includes different forms of cooperation between a tutor and students: lectures, presentations and in-group discussions enabling to strengthen attention of the audience to the issues to be examined. The students will be obliged to write essays on one of the issues to be optionally chosen and then investigated.

代数几何是现代数学的一个重要分支学科，它的基本研究对象是代数簇（即一组多项式的公共零点集）。经典代数几何主要研究代数曲线与代数曲面的性质。到20世纪40年代，韦伊利用抽象代数的方法建立了抽象代数几何。50年代，格罗腾迪克把代数几何发展为一般的概形理论，这使得代数几何的研究进入一个全新的阶段。近几十年来，代数几何与拓扑、微分几何、复几何乃至物理（尤其是超弦理论）等学科都有着广泛的联系、并且相互促进。本课程主要介绍代数几何方面的基础知识，包括仿射与射影平面、二次曲线、三次曲线、曲线分类、仿射簇、射影簇与态射、拟射影簇、Hilbert基本定理、Hilbert零点定理、Zariski 拓扑、坐标环、函数域、有理映射、切空间、光滑性与维数、Blowing-up及奇点解消等内容。本课程要求学生掌握代数几何的一些基本概念及基础知识。

群表示论即是用具体的线性群即矩阵群来研究群的理论。它包含了紧致群表示，李群与李代数表示等多种分支， 在数学物理及数学的多个领域都有重要的应用。在本课程中，我们将主要介绍有限群的表示理论：特征标理论，诱导与限制表示, 有限群的模表示及其Brauer特征标理论等。 本课程要求学生熟悉有限群表示的基本概念， 掌握特征标理论， 对群表示论的方法及应用有初步的了解。

这个课程介绍软件工程学，软件生命周期，软件质量控制，软件设计，软件规范，软件确认，编程环境和工具，面向对象的编程方法。学生将学习面向对象的分析和设计。这些学习中将逐步引入关键技能，基本面向对象的原则和模式，UML记号，最佳软件实践。掌握如何将UML应用到面向对象的软件开发中。
